newsitem.title: JAPAN: Hitachi Software rises to high for 1997.
newsitem.headline: Hitachi Software rises to high for 1997.

text.p: Shares of Hitachi Software Engineering Co Ltd jumped for the fourth consecutive day and reached a fresh high for 1997 on Thursday.
Growing demand for personal computers as well as for new software to solve the millennium bug spurred buying of Hitachi software's shares, traders said.
The shares of the major computer software company briefly rose to 2,690 yen, a new high for this calendar year. At 0055 GMT, they stood 110 yen higher at 2,680. Volume was 391,000 shares.

Traders said demand for new software was growing, as problems could arise from computer programmes that read only the last two digits in a year. The 00 reading for 2000 would cause an error in programmes, they said.
